verses.text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto \add my\add* soul.
I sink in deep mire, where \add there is\add* no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: Mine eyes fail while \add I\add* wait for my God.

They that hate me without a cause are moe than the hairs of mine head: They that would destroy me, \add being\add* mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: Then I restored \add that\add* which I took not away.
O God, thou knowest my foolishness; And my sins are not hid from thee.
Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord \sc God\sc* of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: Let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; Shame hath covered my face.
I am become a stranger unto my brethren, And an alien unto my motherâ€™s children.
For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; And the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
When I wept, \add and chastened\add* my soul with fasting, That was to my reproach.
I made sackcloth also my garment; And I became a proverb to them.
They that sit in the gate speak against me; And \add I was\add* the song of the drunkards.
But \add as for\add* me, my prayer \add is\add* unto thee, O \sc Lord\sc*, \add in\add* an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.
Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: Let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
Let not the waterflood overflow me, Neither let the deep swallow me up, And let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
Hear me, O \sc Lord\sc*; for thy lovingkindness \add is\add* good: Turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
And hide not thy face from thy servant; For I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
Draw nigh unto my soul, \add and\add* redeem it: Deliver me because of mine enemies.
Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: Mine adversaries \add are\add* all before thee.
Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: And I looked \add for some\add* to take pity, but \add there was\add* none; And for comforters, but I found none.
They gave me also gall for my meat; And in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
Let their table become a snare before them: And \add that which should have been\add* for \add their\add* welfare, \add let it become\add* a trap.
Let their eyes be darkened, that \add they\add* see not; And make their loins continually to shake.
Pour out thine indignation upon them, And let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
Let their habitation be desolate; \add And\add* let none dwell in their tents.
For they persecute \add him\add* whom thou hast smitten; And they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
Add iniquity unto their iniquity: And let them not come into thy righteousness.
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, And not be written with the righteous.
But I \add am\add* poor and sorrowful: Let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
I will praise the name of God with a song; And will magnify him with thanksgiving.
\add This\add* also shall please the \sc Lord\sc* better than an ox \add Or\add* bullock that hath horns \add and\add* hoofs.
The humble shall see \add this, and\add* be glad: And your heart shall live that seek God.
For the \sc Lord\sc* heareth the poor, And despiseth not his prisoners.
Let the heaven and earth praise him, The seas, and every \add thing\add* that moveth therein.
For God will save Zion, And will build the cities of Judah: That they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: And they that love his name shall dwell therein.
